remarks: A join's first argument is less than or equal to the join.  (Contributed by NM, 16-Sep-2011.)
statement:
joinval2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
joinval2.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
joinval2.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
joinval2.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. V ) $.
joinval2.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
joinval2.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
joinlem.e $e |- ( ph -> <. X , Y >. e. dom .\/ ) $.
lejoin1 $p |- ( ph -> X .<_ ( X .\/ Y ) ) $.
